result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Patrick Sorenson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas Patrick Sorenson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 9:51 a.m.  Includes 16CF183 and 16CM51. Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - State in agreement with recommendation from probation.  Weber addresses the court.  Thorie - time served on disorderly conduct.  Thorie asking for 9 months jail on 16CF62, feels  that is appropriate.  100 days credit, 102 days left to serve.  Weber addresses the court regarding sentencing - asking for 5 months jail.  Defendant addresses the court regarding sentencing. Court addresses the parties regarding sentencing.  Court orders time served on the 2 disorderly conducts, on bail jumping 7 months in PCo Jail, credit for time served of 100 days, 57 days remaining to be served, release date of August 16, 2017.  Appeal rights are given.  Court costs to be reduced to civil judgment.  10:22 a.m.
from Probation Agent T Gilby re: Defendant is not suitable for supervision
Defendant's Amended JOC. Not deliverable as addressed.

9:52 a.m.  Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Tricia Gilby in court for DOC.  Thorie - Ms. Anderson requesting all contact restrictions lifted, state doesn't agree, State agrees with Agent Gilby's recommendation, 45 days.  Weber disagrees and requests Mr. Sorenson be released today.  Complete domestic violence program. Requesting no contact be lifted.  Requesting 27 days jail that would be ending today.  Mr. Sorenson addresses the court.  Court agrees with recommendation from DOC and State.  45 days Pierce County Jail, release date April 14, 2017.  10:00 a.m.
J Weber
from Probation/Parole Agent Gilby re: violations and recommending 45 conditional jail time.
Probation review hearing on March 27, 2017 at 09:45 am.
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission.

Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF85, 16CF183, 16CM51 and 16CM60. THorie: guilty to Ct#2 in 16CM51, Ct#4 in 16FF62, #2 in 16CF183. 16CF85 and 16CM60 dismiss. Dismiss remaining counts in 16CM51,16CF62 and 16CF183. Probation; concurrent on each case. Atty Nelson and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Def pleas guilty to Ct#4 in 16CF82, Ct#2 in 16CF183 and Ct#2 in 16CM51; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis for charge.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#4 in 16CF62, Ct#2 in 16CF183 and Ct#2 in 16CM51. Court dismiss Ct#1-3 in 16CF62, 16CF85, Ct#1 in 16CF183, Ct#1 in 16CM51 and 16CM60. Thorie and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court: S/W 1 years probation; concurrent (Ct#4 16CF62, Ct#2 16CF183 and 16CM51) conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, agent to consider any additional AODA treatment or program, comply with all conditions imposed by Agent.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Pamela Anderson
Plea hearing on January 10, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

11:15 Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson not in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie:  three other cases scheduled for pre-trial at this time and defendant had notice, on this case mail came back, requests warrants on on this case and 16CF62, 16CM51, 16CM60.  Nelson: questions address on complaint in this case, no information on his whereabouts.  Court authorizes warrants on 16CF85, 16CF62, 16CM51, 16CM60 and will sign upon presentation.
for Atty Liesl Nelson
Pre-trial conference on May 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:33   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty plea on all counts at preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas received by the court. Nelson: requests modification of bond, defendant cannot post bond and has a job.  Thorie: objects to bond modification and if a modification is made requests additional provisions of no alcohol.  Court: orders signature bond $10,000.

10:29 Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Nelson:  waiver of preliminary hearing filed.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Def from PCJ

3:42 Defendant Thomas Patrick Sorenson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared via phone.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $2000 cash bond with no contact provision. Nelson objects to cash bond and requests a signature bond. Thorie responds.Court orders a $1,000 cash bond. Court goes over the bond conditions with the Def.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
